full_summary:
** Invitation to Tender: Flight Recorder and Playback Centre Renovation **

**Tender Reference Number:** 23-58167

**Publication Date:** 21 November 2023
**Tender Closing Date:** 14 December 2023, 14:00 (EST)

**Summary:** The National Research Council Canada (NRC) invites qualified contractors to submit a Technical Proposal and a Tender Form in response to the Flight Recorder and Playback Centre Renovation project.

**Proposal Requirements:**

* The proposal must include a Technical Proposal and a Tender Form, each marked accordingly.
* The Technical Proposal should not include any financial information.
* The Tender Form must contain all financial information.
* The proposal must include the front page of this Request for Proposal (RFP) duly completed.
* The proposal must be submitted electronically via email to NRC.BidReceiving-ReceptiondesSoumissions.CNRC@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca.

**Project Scope:**

The scope of work includes the renovation of the Flight Recorder and Playback Centre located in rooms 151, 151A, 151B, 151C, and the instrumentation shop room 152 in U61 at the NRC Upland Campus.

**Selection Criteria:**

* The evaluation will be based on a combination of technical merit (40%) and price (60%).
* The technical merit evaluation will assess the applicant's experience, qualifications, and proposed solutions.
* The price evaluation will assess the proposed price for the project.

**Mandatory Requirements:**

* The applicant must have at least 10 years of experience in general construction services.
* The applicant must provide a Curriculum Vitae (CV) for the proposed site supervisor and project manager.
* The applicant must provide a company profile for the asbestos abatement sub-contractor.

**Evaluation Process:**

* The evaluation committee will review and evaluate all submissions.
* The successful bidder will be the one who accumulates the highest combined score of technical assessment (40%) and tendered amount (60%).

**Security Clearance:**

* The contractor must hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) issued by the Canadian Industrial Security Directorate (CISD).
* The contractor must provide a copy of the DOS with their submission or within 48 hours of the tender closing date.
* The contractor must name all sub-contractors and provide their security clearance certificates within 72 hours of the tender closing date.

**Procurement Process:**

* The procurement process will be conducted in accordance with the Government of Canada's Rules and Procedures
